field_schema_medicalspecialty_single.label: Schema.org MedicalSpecialty
field_schema_medicalspecialty_single.name: schema_medicalspecialty_single
field_schema_medicalspecialty_single.instructions:
Select one Schema.org MedicalSpecialty enumeration member that is relevant to this entity. If there is no match, then select "None."

For information on the MedicalSpecialty Schema.org enumeration type, visit https://schema.org/MedicalSpecialty.

For information on each of the MedicalSpecialty Schema.org enumeration members, visit the relevant page linked at https://schema.org/MedicalSpecialty#subtypes.

choices.0: None — No available option is relevant to this entity
choices.Anesthesia: Anesthesia — A specific branch of medical science that pertains to study of anesthetics and their application.
choices.Cardiovascular: Cardiovascular — A specific branch of medical science that pertains to diagnosis and treatment of disorders of heart and vasculature.
choices.CommunityHealth: CommunityHealth — A field of public health focusing on improving health characteristics of a defined population in relation with their geographical or environment areas.
choices.Dentistry: Dentistry — A branch of medicine that is involved in the dental care.
choices.Dermatology: Dermatology — A specific branch of medical science that pertains to diagnosis and treatment of disorders of skin.
choices.DietNutrition: DietNutrition — Dietetics and nutrition as a medical specialty.
choices.Emergency: Emergency — A specific branch of medical science that deals with the evaluation and initial treatment of medical conditions caused by trauma or sudden illness.
choices.Endocrine: Endocrine — A specific branch of medical science that pertains to diagnosis and treatment of disorders of endocrine glands and their secretions.
choices.Gastroenterologic: Gastroenterologic — A specific branch of medical science that pertains to diagnosis and treatment of disorders of digestive system.
choices.Genetic: Genetic — A specific branch of medical science that pertains to hereditary transmission and the variation of inherited characteristics and disorders.
choices.Geriatric: Geriatric — A specific branch of medical science that is concerned with the diagnosis and treatment of diseases, debilities and provision of care to the aged.
choices.Gynecologic: Gynecologic — A specific branch of medical science that pertains to the health care of women, particularly in the diagnosis and treatment of disorders affecting the female reproductive system.
choices.Hematologic: Hematologic — A specific branch of medical science that pertains to diagnosis and treatment of disorders of blood and blood producing organs.
choices.Infectious: Infectious — Something in medical science that pertains to infectious diseases, i.e. caused by bacterial, viral, fungal or parasitic infections.
choices.LaboratoryScience: LaboratoryScience — A medical science pertaining to chemical, hematological, immunologic, microscopic, or bacteriological diagnostic analyses or research.
choices.Midwifery: Midwifery — A nurse-like health profession that deals with pregnancy, childbirth, and the postpartum period (including care of the newborn), besides sexual and reproductive health of women throughout their lives.
choices.Musculoskeletal: Musculoskeletal — A specific branch of medical science that pertains to diagnosis and treatment of disorders of muscles, ligaments and skeletal system.
choices.Neurologic: Neurologic — A specific branch of medical science that studies the nerves and nervous system and its respective disease states.
choices.Nursing: Nursing — A health profession of a person formally educated and trained in the care of the sick or infirm person.
choices.Obstetric: Obstetric — A specific branch of medical science that specializes in the care of women during the prenatal and postnatal care and with the delivery of the child.
choices.Oncologic: Oncologic — A specific branch of medical science that deals with benign and malignant tumors, including the study of their development, diagnosis, treatment and prevention.
choices.Optometric: Optometric — The science or practice of testing visual acuity and prescribing corrective lenses.
choices.Otolaryngologic: Otolaryngologic — A specific branch of medical science that is concerned with the ear, nose and throat and their respective disease states.
choices.Pathology: Pathology — A specific branch of medical science that is concerned with the study of the cause, origin and nature of a disease state, including its consequences as a result of manifestation of the disease. In clinical care, the term is used to designate a branch of medicine using laboratory tests to diagnose and determine the prognostic significance of illness.
choices.Pediatric: Pediatric — A specific branch of medical science that specializes in the care of infants, children and adolescents.
choices.PharmacySpecialty: PharmacySpecialty — The practice or art and science of preparing and dispensing drugs and medicines
choices.Physiotherapy: Physiotherapy — The practice of treatment of disease, injury, or deformity by physical methods such as massage, heat treatment, and exercise rather than by drugs or surgery.
choices.PlasticSurgery: PlasticSurgery — A specific branch of medical science that pertains to therapeutic or cosmetic repair or re-formation of missing, injured or malformed tissues or body parts by manual and instrumental means.
choices.Podiatric: Podiatric — Podiatry is the care of the human foot, especially the diagnosis and treatment of foot disorders.
choices.PrimaryCare: PrimaryCare — The medical care by a physician, or other health-care professional, who is the patient's first contact with the health-care system and who may recommend a specialist if necessary.
choices.Psychiatric: Psychiatric — A specific branch of medical science that is concerned with the study, treatment, and prevention of mental illness, using both medical and psychological therapies.
choices.PublicHealth: PublicHealth — Branch of medicine that pertains to the health services to improve and protect community health, especially epidemiology, sanitation, immunization, and preventive medicine.
choices.Pulmonary: Pulmonary — A specific branch of medical science that pertains to the study of the respiratory system and its respective disease states.
choices.Radiography: Radiography — Radiography is an imaging technique that uses electromagnetic radiation other than visible light, especially X-rays, to view the internal structure of a non-uniformly composed and opaque object such as the human body.
choices.Renal: Renal — A specific branch of medical science that pertains to the study of the kidneys and its respective disease states.
choices.RespiratoryTherapy: RespiratoryTherapy — The therapy that is concerned with the maintenance or improvement of respiratory function (as in patients with pulmonary disease).
choices.Rheumatologic: Rheumatologic — A specific branch of medical science that deals with the study and treatment of rheumatic, autoimmune or joint diseases.
choices.SpeechPathology: SpeechPathology — The scientific study and treatment of defects, disorders, and malfunctions of speech and voice, as stuttering, lisping, or lalling, and of language disturbances, as aphasia or delayed language acquisition.
choices.Surgical: Surgical — A specific branch of medical science that pertains to treating diseases, injuries and deformities by manual and instrumental means.
choices.Toxicologic: Toxicologic — A specific branch of medical science that is concerned with poisons, their nature, effects and detection and involved in the treatment of poisoning.
choices.Urologic: Urologic — A specific branch of medical science that is concerned with the diagnosis and treatment of diseases pertaining to the urinary tract and the urogenital system.

field_schema_medicalspecialty_multiple.label: Schema.org MedicalSpecialty (Multiple)
field_schema_medicalspecialty_multiple.name: schema_medicalspecialty_multiple
field_schema_medicalspecialty_multiple.instructions:
Select one or more Schema.org MedicalSpecialty enumeration members that are relevant to this entity. If there is no match, then select "None."

For information on the MedicalSpecialty Schema.org enumeration type, visit https://schema.org/MedicalSpecialty.

For information on each of the MedicalSpecialty Schema.org enumeration members, visit the relevant page linked at https://schema.org/MedicalSpecialty#subtypes.

field_schema_sameas.name: schema_sameas
field_schema_sameas.label: Reference Webpages (sameAs)
field_schema_sameas.instructions:
Reference webpages (e.g., Wikipedia article) or URI-identified RDF class from an external vocabulary (e.g., Wikidata entry, Library of Congress Name Authority File) that unambiguously indicates the entity's identity.

Wikipedia: https://en.wikipedia.org/

Wikidata: https://www.wikidata.org/

Library of Congress Name Authority File: https://id.loc.gov/authorities/names.html

Virtual International Authority File: https://viaf.org/

FAST Authority File: https://experimental.worldcat.org/fast/

sub_fields.label: Reference Webpage URI or URL
sub_fields.name: schema_sameas_url
sub_fields.instructions: Add the URI or permalink if it is available. Otherwise, add the URL.

field_schema_additionalType.name: schema_additionalType
field_schema_additionalType.label: More Specific Type For This Entity From External Vocabularies in Microdata Syntax (additionalType)
field_schema_additionalType.instructions:
The available types on Schema.org are not always the most specific. External vocabularies can be used to associate this entity with a more specific type.

Add the URI-identified RDF class from an external vocabulary (e.g., Wikidata entry, Library of Congress Name Authority File).

Wikidata: https://www.wikidata.org/

Library of Congress Name Authority File: https://id.loc.gov/authorities/names.html

Virtual International Authority File: https://viaf.org/

FAST Authority File: https://experimental.worldcat.org/fast/

field_schema_alternatename.name: schema_alternatename
field_schema_alternatename.label: Alternate Names
field_schema_alternatename.instructions: Acronyms, shortened names or alternate spellings of the entity

field_schema_medicalcode.label: Medical Code (MedicalCode) for This Entity
field_schema_medicalcode.name: schema_medicalcode
field_schema_medicalcode.instructions:
A medical code for the entity, taken from a controlled vocabulary or ontology (e.g., ICD-11, DiseasesDB, MeSH, SNOMED-CT, RxNorm).

For information on the MedicalCode Schema.org type, visit https://schema.org/MedicalCode.

DiseasesDB (Diseases Database): http://www.diseasesdatabase.com/

ICD-10-CM (International Statistical Classification of Diseases and Related Health Problems, Tenth Revision, Clinical Modification): https://icd10cmtool.cdc.gov/ or https://www.icd10data.com/

ICD-10-PCS (International Statistical Classification of Diseases and Related Health Problems, Tenth Revision, Procedure Coding System): https://www.icd10data.com/

ICD-11 (International Statistical Classification of Diseases and Related Health Problems, Eleventh Revision): https://icd.who.int/browse11/

ICHI (International Classification of Health Interventions): https://icd.who.int/dev11/l-ichi/en

ICPC-3 (International Classification of Primary Care, Third Revision): https://browser.icpc-3.info/

MeSH (Medical Subject Headings): https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/mesh/

RxNorm: https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/RxNav/

SNOMED-CT: https://browser.ihtsdotools.org/

sub_fields.label: Coding System (codingSystem)
sub_fields.name: schema_medicalcode_codingsystem
sub_fields.instructions:
Select from the list of coding systems or enter a custom option.

For information on the codingSystem Schema.org property, visit https://schema.org/codingSystem.

sub_fields.label: Code Value (codeValue)
sub_fields.name: schema_medicalcode_codevalue
sub_fields.instructions:
A short textual code that uniquely identifies the value.

For information on the codeValue Schema.org property, visit https://schema.org/codeValue.

sub_fields.name: schema_medicalcode_url
sub_fields.label: URI or URL of the Code Description or Detail Page (url)

field_schema_medicalentity_subtype_avail.name: schema_medicalentity_subtype_availableservice
field_schema_medicalentity_subtype_avail.label: MedicalEntity Subtype (availableService)
field_schema_medicalentity_subtype_avail.instructions:
Select the most appropriate subtype of MedicalEntity.

For information on each subtype, visit the relevant page linked at https://schema.org/MedicalEntity#subtypes.

choices.MedicalTest: MedicalTest — Any medical test, typically performed for diagnostic purposes.
choices.MedicalProcedure: MedicalProcedure — A medical procedure is a process of care used in either a diagnostic, therapeutic, preventive or palliative capacity that relies on invasive (surgical), non-invasive, or other techniques.

field_schema_medicaltest_subtype.name: schema_medicaltest_subtype
field_schema_medicaltest_subtype.label: MedicalTest Subtype (availableService)
field_schema_medicaltest_subtype.instructions:
Select the most appropriate subtype of MedicalTest.

For descriptions of each, visit the relevant page linked at https://schema.org/MedicalTest#subtypes.

choices.0: None — Either MedicalTest is specific enough or no other subtype option is relevant.
choices.BloodTest: Blood Test — A medical test performed on a sample of a patient's blood.
choices.ImagingTest: Imaging Test — Any medical imaging modality typically used for diagnostic purposes.
choices.MedicalTestPanel: Medical Test Panel — Any collection of tests commonly ordered together.
choices.PathologyTest: Pathology Test — A medical test performed by a laboratory that typically involves examination of a tissue sample by a pathologist.

field_schema_medicalprocedure_subtype.name: schema_medicalprocedure_subtype
field_schema_medicalprocedure_subtype.label: MedicalProcedure Subtype (availableService)
field_schema_medicalprocedure_subtype.instructions:
Select the most appropriate subtype of MedicalProcedure.

For descriptions of each, visit the relevant page linked at https://schema.org/MedicalProcedure#subtypes.

choices.0: None — Either MedicalProcedure is specific enough or no other subtype option is relevant.
choices.DiagnosticProcedure: Diagnostic Procedure — A medical procedure intended primarily for diagnostic, as opposed to therapeutic, purposes.
choices.PalliativeProcedure: Palliative Procedure — A medical procedure intended primarily for palliative purposes, aimed at relieving the symptoms of an underlying health condition.
choices.PhysicalExam: Physical Exam — A type of physical examination of a patient performed by a physician.
choices.SurgicalProcedure: Surgical Procedure — A medical procedure involving an incision with instruments; performed for diagnose, or therapeutic purposes.
choices.TherapeuticProcedure: Therapeutic Procedure — A medical procedure intended primarily for therapeutic purposes, aimed at improving a health condition.

field_schema_therapeuticprocedure_subtyp.name: schema_therapeuticprocedure_subtype
field_schema_therapeuticprocedure_subtyp.label: TherapeuticProcedure Subtype (availableService)
field_schema_therapeuticprocedure_subtyp.instructions:
Select the most appropriate subtype of TherapeuticProcedure.

For descriptions of each, visit the relevant page linked at https://schema.org/TherapeuticProcedure#subtypes.

choices.0: None — Either TherapeuticProcedure is specific enough or no other subtype option is relevant.
choices.MedicalTherapy: Medical Therapy — Any medical intervention designed to prevent, treat, and cure human diseases and medical conditions, including both curative and palliative therapies. Medical therapies are typically processes of care relying upon pharmacotherapy, behavioral therapy, supportive therapy (with fluid or nutrition for example), or detoxification (e.g., hemodialysis) aimed at improving or preventing a health condition.
choices.PsychologicalTreatment: Psychological Treatment — A process of care relying upon counseling, dialogue and communication aimed at improving a mental health condition without use of drugs.

field_schema_medicaltherapy_subtype.name: schema_medicaltherapy_subtype
field_schema_medicaltherapy_subtype.label: MedicalTherapy Subtype
field_schema_medicaltherapy_subtype.instructions:
Select the most appropriate subtype of MedicalTherapy.

For descriptions of each, visit the relevant page linked at https://schema.org/MedicalTherapy#subtypes.

choices.0: None — Either MedicalTherapy is specific enough or no other subtype option is relevant.
choices.OccupationalTherapy: Occupational Therapy — A treatment of people with physical, emotional, or social problems, using purposeful activity to help them overcome or learn to deal with their problems.
choices.PalliativeProcedure: Palliative Procedure — A medical procedure intended primarily for palliative purposes, aimed at relieving the symptoms of an underlying health condition.
choices.PhysicalTherapy: Physical Therapy — A process of progressive physical care and rehabilitation aimed at improving a health condition.
choices.RadiationTherapy: Radiation Therapy — A process of care using radiation aimed at improving a health condition.
choices.RespiratoryTherapy: Respiratory Therapy — The therapy that is concerned with the maintenance or improvement of respiratory function (as in patients with pulmonary disease).

field_schema_MedicalImagingTechnique.name: schema_MedicalImagingTechnique
field_schema_MedicalImagingTechnique.label: Imaging Technique Used (MedicalImagingTechnique)
field_schema_MedicalImagingTechnique.instructions:
Select the most appropriate MedicalImagingTechnique enumeration member.

For information on the imagingTechnique Schema.org property, visit https://schema.org/imagingTechnique.

For information on the MedicalImagingTechnique Schema.org enumeration type, visit https://schema.org/MedicalImagingTechnique.

choices.Radiography: Radiography — Radiography is an imaging technique that uses electromagnetic radiation other than visible light, especially X-rays, to view the internal structure of a non-uniformly composed and opaque object such as the human body.

field_schema_subtest.label: Component Tests of the Panel (subTest)
field_schema_subtest.name: schema_subtest
field_schema_subtest.instructions: For information on the subTest Schema.org property, visit https://schema.org/subTest.

field_schema_tissuesample.name: schema_tissuesample
field_schema_tissuesample.label: Tissue Sample Type (tissueSample)
field_schema_tissuesample.instructions:
The type of tissue sample required for the test.

For information on the tissueSample Schema.org property, visit https://schema.org/tissueSample.

field_schema_usedtodiagnose.label: Condition(s) the Test Is Used to Diagnose (usedToDiagnose)
field_schema_usedtodiagnose.name: schema_usedtodiagnose
field_schema_usedtodiagnose.instructions: For information on the subTest Schema.org property, visit https://schema.org/usedToDiagnose.

field_schema_usesdevice.name: schema_usesdevice
field_schema_usesdevice.label: Device Used (usesDevice)
field_schema_usesdevice.instructions:
For information on the usesDevice Schema.org property, visit https://schema.org/usesDevice.

For information on the MedicalDevice Schema.org type, visit https://schema.org/MedicalDevice.

sub_fields.name: schema_usesdevice_code
sub_fields.label: Code (code)
sub_fields.instructions:
For information on the usesDevice Schema.org property, visit https://schema.org/code.

For information on the MedicalCode Schema.org type, visit https://schema.org/MedicalCode.

sub_fields.name: schema_usesdevice_code_codingsystem
sub_fields.label: Coding System (codingSystem)
sub_fields.instructions: For information on the codingSystem Schema.org property, visit https://schema.org/codingSystem.

sub_fields.name: schema_usesdevice_code_code
sub_fields.label: Individual Device Code (codeValue)
sub_fields.instructions:
For information on the usesDevice Schema.org property, visit https://schema.org/code.

For information on the MedicalCode Schema.org type, visit https://schema.org/MedicalCode.

sub_fields.name: schema_usesdevice_code_name
sub_fields.label: Name Associated With the Device Code (name)

sub_fields.name: schema_usesdevice_code_url
sub_fields.label: URL of Device Code Description or Detail Page (url)

field_schema_medicalproceduretype.name: schema_medicalproceduretype
field_schema_medicalproceduretype.label: Type of Procedure (procedureType)
field_schema_medicalproceduretype.instructions:
Select the most appropriate MedicalProcedureType.

For information on the medicalProcedureType Schema.org property, visit https://schema.org/procedureType.

For information on the MedicalProcedureType Schema.org enumeration type, visit https://schema.org/MedicalProcedureType.

choices.NoninvasiveProcedure: NoninvasiveProcedure — A type of medical procedure that involves noninvasive techniques.
choices.PercutaneousProcedure: PercutaneousProcedure — A type of medical procedure that involves percutaneous techniques, where access to organs or tissue is achieved via needle-puncture of the skin. For example, catheter-based procedures like stent delivery.

field_schema_drug.label: Drug or Medicine Used (Drug)
field_schema_drug.name: schema_drug
field_schema_drug.instructions:
If relevant, add the drug or medicine used in the medication procedure.

For information on the Drug Schema.org type, visit https://schema.org/Drug.

sub_fields.label: Proprietary Name (proprietaryName)
sub_fields.name: schema_drug_proprietaryname
sub_fields.instructions:
Proprietary name(s) given to the drug, typically by its originator(s) or creator(s). Search RxNorm at https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/RxNav/ to find or confirm this information.

For information on the proprietaryName Schema.org property, visit https://schema.org/proprietaryName.

sub_fields.label: Generic Name (nonProprietaryName)
sub_fields.name: schema_drug_nonproprietaryname
sub_fields.instructions:
The generic name(s) of this drug or supplement. Search RxNorm at https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/RxNav/ to find or confirm this information.

For information on the nonProprietaryName Schema.org property, visit https://schema.org/nonProprietaryName.

sub_fields.label: DrugPrescriptionStatus
sub_fields.name: schema_drug_drugprescriptionstatus
sub_fields.instructions:
Indicate whether this drug is available by prescription or over-the-counter.

For information on the DrugPrescriptionStatus Schema.org enumeration type, visit https://schema.org/DrugPrescriptionStatus.

For information on the enumeration members of the DrugPrescriptionStatus Schema.org enumeration type, visit the links at https://schema.org/DrugPrescriptionStatus#subtypes.

sub_fields.label: rxcui
sub_fields.name: schema_drug_rxcui
sub_fields.instructions:
The RxCUI drug identifier from RxNorm. Search RxNorm at https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/RxNav/.

For information on the rxcui Schema.org property, visit https://schema.org/rxcui.

field_schema_duplicatetherapy.label: Duplicate Therapy (duplicateTherapy)
field_schema_duplicatetherapy.name: schema_duplicatetherapy
field_schema_duplicatetherapy.instructions:
Select any other therapies that duplicate or overlaps this one.

For information on the duplicateTherapy Schema.org property, visit https://schema.org/duplicateTherapy.

field_schema_medicalcondition_subtype.name: schema_medicalcondition_subtype
field_schema_medicalcondition_subtype.label: MedicalCondition Subtype
field_schema_medicalcondition_subtype.instructions:
Select the most appropriate subtype of MedicalCondition.

For information on the Schema.org MedicalCondition type, visit https://schema.org/MedicalCondition.

For information on each subtype, visit the relevant page linked at https://schema.org/MedicalCondition#Subtypes.

choices.0: None — No available option is relevant to this entity
choices.InfectiousDisease: InfectiousDisease — An infectious disease is a clinically evident human disease resulting from the presence of pathogenic microbial agents, like pathogenic viruses, pathogenic bacteria, fungi, protozoa, multicellular parasites, and prions. To be considered an infectious disease, such pathogens are known to be able to cause this disease.
choices.MedicalSignOrSymptom: MedicalSignOrSymptom — Any feature associated or not with a medical condition. In medicine a symptom is generally subjective while a sign is objective.

field_schema_infectiousagentclass.name: schema_infectiousagentclass
field_schema_infectiousagentclass.label: InfectiousAgentClass
field_schema_infectiousagentclass.instructions:
Select the class of agents or pathogens that transmits this infectious disease.

For information on the Schema.org InfectiousAgentClass enumeration type, visit For information on each enumeration member, visit the relevant page linked at https://schema.org/InfectiousAgentClass#subtypes.

choices.0: None — No available option is relevant to this entity
choices.Bacteria: Bacteria — Pathogenic bacteria that cause bacterial infection.
choices.MulticellularParasite: MulticellularParasite — Multicellular parasite that causes an infection.
choices.Prion: Prion — A prion is an infectious agent composed of protein in a misfolded form.
choices.Protozoa: Protozoa — Single-celled organism that causes an infection.
choices.Virus: Virus — Pathogenic virus that causes viral infection.
